intro: Tacsonia flexipes, commonly known as the flexible tacsonia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Tacsonia flexipes thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it a valuable species for ecological studies and traditional herbal medicine.
